III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided related to Rule 4160 Emergency restraint and ensuring
staff are aware of the changes made to the rule and when a restraint is required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s budget
and the agency financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed and submitted for review. The
assessment documented that compliance had been achieved as a result of the one
CAP that was required during the renewal assessment in May 2022.
3

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported feeling very supported by management, participating in training, and
feel that the agency is meeting the needs of the youths the service.
The facility does not have any current youths, so youths were not interviewed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is a short-term shelter type residential one-story home with a basement.
It has a living room, dining room, kitchen, bathroom, and two bedrooms with three
beds in each bedroom. The facility was found to be clean, neat, and appropriate.
There were no issues of concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
